channel.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
channel.description:
To keep things simple I'll just provide the relevant information.
[code=java] Player p = (Player) killer; ((p).MY_INT) += hit; [/code]
MY_INT saves and loads successfully (use the concept "MY_INT" as a global point system (it's not, but this helps explain what it's for)).
In my method for adding experience for damaging an entity, I have an instance of the Player class, p, which should only be specific for that certain player. I log in with two accounts and when one player gets accumulation to MY_INT, so does every other player.
How do I accumulate to the specific client only?
I've also tried p.MY_INT += hit; and that was exactly the same. I'm also unaware what class file represents the "Client" class in Hyperion, so maybe with just that information I could work the rest out myself?

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:35, topic:423732”]You’ll prestige to 83 in your next rank.

??[/quote]
Lol, no because you don’t experience to 83 in your next Woodcutting level.

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

The word “gain” makes it sound like he has 83 points to go until the next rank, rather than getting the next rank at 83 points.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:

You will reach your next Prestige Rank when you gain 83 Prestige points. Is that too much?

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

It’s pre-alpha. I’ll be perfecting things as I go along. I’m quite fussed when it comes to how my messages are “designed”, so if you say it sounds wrong I’ll take note to change it.

How about “You will next rank up at 83 Prestige.” There’s only so much you can do, it’s an awkward sentence.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Prestige, being the int. Prestige rank being the String. “Your next Prestige rank is at 83 Prestige.” is the same as saying “Your next Woodcutting level is at 83 experience.”.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Nah, just displaying your current rank (Prestige acts as the exp). It’s just because it was such a low level the levels were constant. Displaying your rank was added to the levelUp method.

Read full topic

item.source: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

It only displays your current Prestige when you gain a level (I used it like leveling up shows your current level). As you are dealing damage you are gaining Prestige “points”, and then after a certain point is reached your rank changes. The highest so far is Champion at 5,000,000 Prestige (would take a while).

It will be a world wide system, so say if you die, you lose Prestige, if you win Castle Wars, you gain Prestige etc.

I plan to add it so that if you click a book of some sort, it shows an interface displaying all your statistics and maybe an NPC that tells you your rank too.

Read full topic
item.source: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global

item.title: Hyperion - Client Specific Variable is Global
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

imsuperman05:

Like zyle said, you’re calling the variable statically which basically calls the whole Player class, not specified at which player instance therefore anything done with that variable goes to the whole server.

Aha, now I fully understand, thanks for that extra input.

Read full topic
